body: @ErkanAksoy  Can you add screenshots of your Sites tree and Context definition screen?

Here are they @psiinon. I tried the same on my Ubuntu box as well.

![zap2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10220856/27285215-98efccfe-5504-11e7-9782-ebca073c3853.png)
Sorry, can you show us a screenshot of the "Include in Context" screen for the relevant context. Thanks

It is what written default by the app when I pick a site to "Include in context". Even If I change it doesn't matter as following. (First line is default one, second is the one that I modify)
http://192.168.188.128.*
http://192.168.188.128*

![zap3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10220856/27285496-9782e486-5505-11e7-9d76-0ff29086e556.png)


Thank you very much by the way. And my app version is 2.6.0

rename.to: Sites tree option Show only URLs in Scope not working

body: Thanks for the information! The URLs are being included in context, it's the filtering/rendering of the tree that's not working properly.

As I am quite new in ZAProxy, I hope that I didn't done anything wrong but found a bug. So It would be better If someone else can confirm this. Honestly I am quite new in web app pentesting and still confused If should go for it after 12 years of systems admin job.

Thanks and regards.

issue.title: Use correct component when filtering Sites nodes

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Change SiteMapTreeCellRenderer to use/return the label (the one hidden)
instead of the panel, also, return immediately (no need to further
process the panel/label).

Fix #3675 - Sites tree option Show only URLs in Scope not working

body:
Here is the result of latest daily build, site tree doesn't populate site addresses anymore. Also filter is still not working according to number of sites in the tree.

![zap4](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10220856/27303056-1e4cedfe-5542-11e7-9b8d-2559a88c44e0.png)
With latest daily build do you mean the weekly release? That version does not include the fix.
Sorry for that @thc202, I meant latest weekly build. I now see that build doesn't fix the issue on this topic, just take it as a feedback for D-2017-06-19 :)
No worries. I saw that behaviour with the weekly as well, that's why I was asking.

issue.title: Show only URLS in scope - Not working for Sites in macOS

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
It appears that this issue was brought up before - #3675, and has resurfaced. 

I'm running Zap 2.6.0  primarily on Windows 10 but I the issue also happens with Kali Linux.

![zap_showurlsscope](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22101253/31064748-291f8d46-a6f4-11e7-83e9-637e905056ce.png)

body: For the record, the issue mentioned in https://github.com/zaproxy/zaproxy/issues/3675#issuecomment-309554848 was addressed in #3351.
This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
